body: Ogres sometimes interbreed with other giants. The result of such crossbreeding is a giantkin ogre, which gains some abilities from its non-ogre parents. In areas where ogre clans live near large populations of giants, interbreeding can be so common that entire ogre clans consist solely of giantkin.
name: Ogre Giantkin Template

sections.body: Blessed with the blood of greater giants, giantkin ogres are larger and stronger than their normal ogre relatives and gain abilities from their giant progenitors.
sections.name: Giantkin (CR +1)

sections.body: Hit points +10 hit points; Saving Throws +1 racial bonus to all saving throws; Ability Scores +4 Strength, +4 Constitution; Special Attacks rock throwing (1d6, 90 ft.), Special see table.

CrossbreedSpecial Abilities
FirebloodResist fire 10
FrostbloodResist cold 10
HillbloodIncrease natural armor by 2
StonebloodRock catching, rock throwing (1d8, 120 ft.)
